title: Media and Film Staff visa (subclass 423)
summary: This page provides information about the Media and Film Staff visa (subclass 423), which closed to new applications on 24 November 2012. It outlines the rights and obligations of current visa holders and the responsibilities of approved sponsors. It also suggests alternative visa options for prospective applicants.

alternative_visas.purpose: for people who want to come to Australia to make a documentary or commercial
for short stays up to three months
allowed_activities: make a documentary or commercial shown outside Australia (not intended for Australian viewing)
short-term non-ongoing work as a journalist or foreign correspondent

visa_entitlements: undertake media work in Australia for an Australian-based company or production house
stay in Australia for the period of the nominated position (up to 2 years)
bring family members who can work and study
travel multiple times in and out of Australia while visa is valid
obligations: comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
maintain adequate health insurance while in Australia
work_restrictions: must not stop working for sponsoring employer
must not engage in work inconsistent with nominated position
must not work for another person or for themselves while working for sponsor

changing_sponsor.instructions: must apply for another visa if changing position or employer

family_obligations.entry_restrictions: family cannot enter Australia before primary visa holder
family_obligations.departure_requirements: family must leave Australia when the visa ends
ongoing_obligations: intend to remain a member of the family unit
family_entitlements: family can work or study while visa is valid

change_notifications: changes to phone number, email, address or passport

sponsor_information.note: Sponsorship for this visa is closed; no new sponsorships allowed.
nomination_validity_conditions: date written withdrawal of nomination is received
3 months after sponsor approval ceases (if nomination was granted to that sponsor)
date sponsor approval is cancelled (if nomination was granted to that sponsor)
date visa is granted based on the nomination
sponsor_obligations: notify the department when certain events occur
provide records and information to the Minister when requested
not recover, transfer, or charge certain costs to another person
pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
ensure visa holder works in nominated occupation, program or activity

obligation_period.start: day sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
obligation_period.end: 5 years after sponsorship ends or work agreement ceases

required_actions: produce and provide documents within requested timeframe
not prevent access to persons with custody of records
provide officers with access to interview persons on premises

requirements: keep records showing compliance with obligations
keep all records in a reproducible format
some records must be independently verifiable
keep notifications made to the department, including date, method, and location of submission

obligation_period.end: 2 years after sponsor is no longer approved AND no longer sponsoring anyone

when_required: to determine compliance with sponsorship obligations
to determine other circumstances for administrative action
must_provide_if: record is required under Commonwealth/state/territory law
record is required to be kept as a sponsor

obligation_period.start: day sponsorship is approved or work agreement starts
obligation_period.end: 2 years after sponsorship or work agreement ceases AND no sponsored visa holders remain

events_to_report: primary sponsored person fails to participate in nominated activity
cessation of participation in film or television production
primary sponsored person (except performers) ceases before approved cessation date
sponsor ceases to hold required licence
changes to sponsor’s address or contact details
sponsor’s legal entity ceases to exist (if an Australian organisation)
method: send by registered post or electronic mail
